oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Relative encryption overhead in 802.11g network
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TRIPATHI, A
DAMANI, OP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wireless networks
security overhead
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a performance study of security overheads in 802.11g networks. At 54 Mbps, the security overhead becomes significant in single client scenarios for many of the popular security protocols. However, we find that the most secure protocol, WPA-2, is also the protocol with the lowest security overhead.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2008 INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON TELECOMMUNICATIONS, VOLS 1 AND 2,420-423
